item.title: Pramita add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Pramita add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Pramita add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Pramita add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Pramita add a quote by Elinor Glyn
item.description: "Romance is the glamour which turns the dust of everyday life into a golden haze. " -- Elinor Glyn

item.title: Pramita add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Pramita add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "The one thing that unites all human beings, regardless of age, gender, religion, economic status, or ethnic background, is that, deep down inside, we all believe that we are above-average drivers." -- Dave Barry

item.title: Pramita add a quote by William Shakespeare
Pramita add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "Never give in. Never give in. Never, never, never, never—in nothing, great or small, large or petty—never give in, except to convictions of honour and good sense. Never yield to force. Never yield to the apparently overwhelming might of the enemy." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Pramita add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It is a great thing to start life with a small number of really good books which are your very own." -- Arthur Conan Doyle
